intro: Carex charkeviczii, commonly known as the Charkevicz sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to Central Asia and is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along the edges of water bodies. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and improve water quality. Carex charkeviczii is a hardy perennial that thrives in temperate climates.
